result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald N Kovalaske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days, or serve 10 days jail as penalty for non-payment.
The Court orders the gun used in the matter be destroyed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald N Kovalaske

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Photos presented by Attorney Wolff for purposes of sentencing.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Donald N Kovalaske in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant pled Guilty to count 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2. 
Count 1 is dismissed and read in.
  Court orders a fine of $505.00 inclusive of costs to be paid within 90 days or serve 10 days jail as penalty for non payment of fine.
Court further orders the gun in this matter be destroyed.
